page.title: 09AN OLD RESIDENT_SKELMERSDALE
page.content:
A biography of Mr.Fred Ackary who has lived his entire life in Skelmersdale.
TELL US A LITTLE ABOUT YOURSELF. I was born on May 21st.1914,above my father's tobacconist's shop in Sandy Lane.As a child I went to Barnes Rd. Primary School and then Upholland Grammar School.I worked in my father's shop for 16 years and the family lived above it.I was in the army for 6 years from 1939-45.In 1945 I married Irene and we moved to Witham Rd. where we still live.I worked at Pilkington's Laboratories at Lathom for 15 years until I retired in 1979.
WHAT WAS SKELMERSDALE LIKE WHEN YOU WERE A CHILD? It was a much smaller and friendlier place.It had a population of 4000 before the war.
